it.polimi.polishare.common.DHT.chord

Class Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.polishare.common.DHT.chord.Key
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Key>

    public class Key
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Key>, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a key at chord level. All keys at chord's level can be seen as natural numbers belonging to the interval [0, 2^m). It provides also methods for key's comparison.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int m
      The parameter m represents the maximum exponent such as (2^m)-1 is a valid key for the ring.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Key(java.lang.String stringKey)
      Creates a new key based on the provided string key.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(Key key)
      Compares this Key with the specified Key for order.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      boolean isRingBetween(Key from, Key to)
      Check if this key belongs to the given interval on the chord ring excluding extremes and taking into account the possible circularity of the interval.
      Key sumPowerOf2(int exponent)
      Returns a new key whose value is equal to that of this key plus 2^exponent.

    • Method Detail

      • isRingBetween

        public boolean isRingBetween(Key from,
                             Key to)
        Check if this key belongs to the given interval on the chord ring excluding extremes and taking into account the possible circularity of the interval.
        Parameters:
        from - start point of the interval
        to - end point of the interval
        Returns:
        true if this key belongs to the given interval on the chord ring, false otherwise.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Key key)
        Compares this Key with the specified Key for order.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Key>
        Parameters:
        key - Key to be compared.
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this Key is less than, equal to, or greater than the given Object.

        Returns:
